title:
[$250] Fix issue where
  • creates a new line

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Problem: When `
  • ` exists, it treats the space as a new line which breaks formatting ``` You can create an expense a few different ways. The most common are:

    Option 1: Manually add an expense
    1. Click the green + Create button in the navigation.
    2. Select Create expense > Manual.
    3. Enter the amount and currency, then click Next.
    4. Choose who it’s for: a workspace (business) or an individual (personal).
    5. Add any details you need (category, tag, description, etc.).
    6. Click Create expense.

    Other ways to create an expense
    • Scan a receipt: + > Create expense > Scan, then upload or drag/drop your receipt.
    • Distance (mileage): + > Create expense > Distance, then enter start/finish and confirm.
    • By email: Forward receipts to receipts@expensify.com from a verified email.
    • By chatting with Concierge: you can also just tell me something like “Create a $45 Home Depot expense for supplies” and I’ll create it for you.
    For full step‑by‑step details and screenshots, see Create an Expense. ``` Solution: Prevent that from occuring so that the above HTML will render normally Internal Issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/568934#issuecomment-3558718975 cc @rushatgabhane

title: [$250] Dynamically load the PDF worker

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Hi, please take a look at my proposal: Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue. The PDF worker lib is a very big part of the vendors bundle What is the root cause of that problem? We are loading the PDF worker (and libraries that use it) along with the main bundle, not taking advantage of any kind of dynamic loading. What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem? We should implement a dynamic loading solution for the libraries, similar to the ones we applied for [heic-to](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/68727) and [xlsx](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/68912). So basically, we should create separate cache groups for the related libraries so they can be loaded separately from the main bundle, which will reduce TTI impact while maintaining offline support. Here is a [draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/74566) with the changes. What specific scenarios should we cover in automated tests to prevent reintroducing this issue in the future? N/A

title: Optimize Search Page Tab Switching Performance

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from this [proposal](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1763625591903539)

### Background:
The Search page is a primary navigation tool within the application, allowing users to filter through Reports, Expenses, and other data types. The header component includes a complex input field and an autocomplete list that parses queries and suggests options (like tax rates, currencies, and tags) in real-time. These components handle significant amounts of data and logic to provide relevant suggestions as the user types.

### Problem:
When navigating the Search page, if the user switches between tabs, then the interface experiences significant lag because the hidden autocomplete component unnecessarily re-renders and performs heavy calculations.

### Solution:
1.  Only mount SearchAutocompleteList when visible, replacing CSS hiding to prevent unnecessary initialization.
2.  Wrap SearchAutocompleteList in React.memo and use useMemo for expensive derived state (parsing queries, grouping options, filtering Onyx data).
3.  Memoize searchQueryItem in SearchPageHeaderInput to prevent downstream re-renders.
4.  Move static list definitions inside usage scopes to avoid allocation on every render.
[DratPR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75550/files)
Performance:
Total render time to switch between time has been reduced from ~406ms to ~238ms  ( ~41% faster)

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @parasharrajat</details>

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @BartekObudzinski</details>

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.61-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2027/folder/13176685/41236597/1026028450 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2099@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Have two accounts opened on two different devices or environments. Prerequisite 2: User A has at least one workspace created. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Invite User B as member of workspace chat. 4. As User B, navigate to chat. 5. Tap on header and leave workspace chat. 6. As User A, navigate to a private room conversation that belongs to the same workspace or create one if necessary. 7. Invite User B to room conversation. 8. As User B, navigate to room conversation. 9. Tap on header and leave the room. 10. Note that before being navigated out of the chat, a "Join" button can be seen on top. ## Expected Result: "Join" option shouldn´t be displayed for a member when leaving room, if the user is not member of the room´s workspace at the same time. ## Actual Result: "Join" option is displayed for room´s member after leaving, if previously user was member of the workspace where the room belongs. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/20c987de-785e-4c43-899e-cc76b597a41b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
